alert.note: Alert for Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 05 at 5:22AM CST until March 05 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: .A dry line will move into portions of northeast Oklahoma Saturday afternoon, possibly as far east as a Nowata to Okemah line. Rapidly falling humidity, very warm temperatures and gusty west to southwest winds will develop behind the dryline which will result in deteriorating fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR OKMULGEE COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CST this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...IN Oklahoma, Okmulgee county. * WIND...Gusty west to southwest wind at 25 to 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...Afternoon RH values falling into the 20 to 30 percent range. * TEMPERATURE...Unseasonably warm conditions with highs around 80 degrees. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that a dangerous combination of weather conditions and dry vegetation is expected within 24 hours, favoring rapid growth and spread of any wildfires. The primary weather factors include stronger winds, lower humidities, and warmer temperatures.
